alert.note: Alert for Butler; New Madrid; Stoddard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 9:47AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of New Madrid, eastern Butler and Stoddard Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 946 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Wappapello State Park to near Kennett. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong showers and thunderstorms will be near...Puxico and Fisk around 1000 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Dudley, Bloomfield, Dexter, Essex, Sikeston, Morehouse, Matthews and Canalou. This includes Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 33 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
